chargeHist.descr: Possess Cocaine with intent to deliver as repeater (>5-15g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven D. DAVIS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Possess Cocaine with intent to deliver (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the prison sentence presently being served on Milwaukee County case no: 08 CF 5925.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Work toward completion of GED or HSED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

No possession of any weapons.

Complete sobriety and abstinence from illegal drug use.

No possession of alcohol, drugs or drug paraphernalia.

Cognitive behavior programming.

Enrollment in vocation training and literary services.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

RE:  Deliver cocaine, on 01-21-14.
Affidavit of Detective Sgt. Peter McGinty, Two River Police Department.
At 9:43 a.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 4 counts deliver cocaine as repeater and possess cocaine with intent to deliver.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-03-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $20,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
